Journey to the Centre of Uncertainty, R A Lyttleton, Speculations in Science & Technology, Vol. 8, No. 5 p.334

"We see 'scientists' so enthusiastic about their idea as to be driven to shift after shift of extravagant adjustments and additional ad hoc assumptions to try at any cost to save the precious well-beloved hypothesis, thereby getting deeper into a mire of confusion, when the situation is really implying that the hypothesis is simply plain wrong."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Save the Theory
